messages: 41347f4c01642f9981ecb528f33cead9 (04:13): debian sid out there?

30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:26): Oracle instance in a RAC setup with 2 sun cluster nodes ... when I reboot one node, the instance on the other node also died.  It'd come back after the other node comes back.
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:27): direct links between the servers without switches for the interconnect?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:28): anything in the cssd log?
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:28): yes, direct links for interconnects , no transport juntions
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:28): thats a problem
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:28): no wait... why is that a problem ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:28): since the remaining node will detect a network failure
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:28): cable problem link lost ... in dmesg?
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:29): let me check
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:29): you should have more exact errors in the cssd and crs logs
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:30): is oracle on xp just total garbage (assuming xp's fault)?
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:30): this stupid thing just will not stay up
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:31): it's ment to be "usable"
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:31): hmm...weird...i can't find a 'log' directory in $ORACLE_HOME/crs
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:32): hali:  how do I restart the whole database? am I supposed to do it directly in the windows services?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:32): or cmd line.. both work
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:32): (aside from rebooting the machine)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:32): you should have a service in services.msc called oracleINSTANCE and oraclelistener
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:33): hali: so I'm not suppposed to use cross-over cable for interconnect  ?    Sun doesn't warn me about it
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:33): Vas: i've had a lot of problems with it.. most people recommend a pair of switches
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:33): hali:  in the task manager I see oracle.exe
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:34): kaylee: check the services thinbgie
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:34): hali: do I have to reinstall sun cluster if I put in the switches ?
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:34): yeah, I tried stoping and starting from there, but didn't bring it back
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:34): cuz I remember when installing sun cluster, it asked whether i had switches or not
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:34): now I see why the boss doesn't want any new apps using oracle
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:35): Vas: perhaps thats a new feature then... it didn't used to do that
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:35): but this is very fundamental flaw if it's true ...
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:35): sun should have documented it
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:36): well, not really.. it all depends on how you threat that "problem" ... what is a dead peer and what is bad interconnect and what is just a rebooting peer
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:37): so you dont' think i need to reinstall the cluster software ?  cuz that's a lot of work , now that oracle DB already has database on it
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:38): brb I'm gunna try rebooting
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:38): Vas: not sure, since i haven't seen that feature before
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:38): another point is that sun usually denies you support if you install sun cluster yourself
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:38): cuz that's what i use
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:38): hm, i think we have some 3.1 boxes.. not sure
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:39): i don't have any memory of seing that question.. but it was probably there
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:39): you 've never seen issue where rebooting one node, the instance on the other node also goes down ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:40): not that it goes gown.. but i've seen tns issues
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:40): since each node has it's own db_unique_name ...
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:41): if there's only 2 nodes, do I need 2 switches or just one switch for both nodes ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:41): you need one, you should have two
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:42): high end one or a couple crappy linksys switches  ok ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:42): as long as they are reliable
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:42): yeah no kiddin'
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:42): i think we use 3com 4200's
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:43): you have one switch for each node ?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:43): or perhaps a pair of hp 2626
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:43): you have two interconnects right
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:43): one for each interconnect
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:44): i'd really want to nail this problem though....i think it's something w/ my settings
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:45): where the heck is crs logs if not in  /u01/app/oracle/product/10.2.0/db_1/crs/log   ?
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:46): ah i know...that's not the right crs dir
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (04:48): you should have sc errors in /var/adm/messages and /var/cluster/logs
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:50): hali: also, I didn't register to let sun cluster to manage oracle rac yet, but that shoudl be ok
30967e36448a9cc4a7b13b48a35ba90a (04:51): as in, shutdown, startup, etc.
1c80b8bed70a687e9ee784f16b92fc27 (04:55): I rebooted, and now it seems to be doing fine
